___Keysize.description: The RSA key size for the Certificate Signing Request (CSR).

___CertTemplate.description: Template Name as it appears in the General tab of the template’s object in the Certificate Templates’ Microsoft Management Console snap-in component.

___PayloadIdentifier.description: A unique identifier for the payload, dot-delimited.  Usually root PayloadIdentifier+subidentifier

___CertServer.description: Fully qualified host name of the Active Directory issuing CA.

___Description.description: The description of the certificate request as shown in the certificate selector of other payloads such as VPN and Network

___AllowAllAppsAccess.description: Allow all apps to access the certificate in the keychain

___CertificateAuthority.description: Name of the CA. This value is determined from the Common Name (CN) of the Active Directory entry: CN=(your CA name), CN='Certification Authorities', CN='Public Key Services', CN='Services', or CN='Configuration', (your base Domain Name).

___CertificateRenewalTimeInterval.description: The number of days before the certificate expires at which to start showing the expiration notification

___UserName.description: The user name with which to authenticate to the certificate server

___PayloadVersion.description: The version of the whole configuration profile.

___Password.description: The password with which to authenticate to the certificate server

___PromptForCredentials.description: Prompt the user for credentials.  This setting is not supported for pushed profiles

___PayloadType.description: The type of the payload, a reverse dns string

___KeyIsExtractable.description: Allow admin to export private key from the keychain

___PayloadOrganization.description: This value describes the issuing organization of the profile, as displayed to the user

___CertificateAcquisitionMechanism.description: Most commonly RPC. If using Web enrollment, HTTP.
